Pre-Game Insights: The Flames will be looking to maintain their perfect start in the qualifiers and utilise home advantage against Tunisia.
Flames coach Patrick Mabedi will likely throw his best players into the fray.
After final training Monday, Mabedi said his troops would not be intimidated by previous records.
He will likely ring some changes to the team that started against Liberia in todayâ€™s match.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Malawi and Tunisia have met seven times since 1987. The Flames have beaten Tunisia twice 3-2 in 1987 and 1-0 in 1989.
However, the Carthage Eagles beat Malawi 3-0 in the same year.
In 2004, Malawi and Tunisia shared the spoils after a 2-2 stalemate at Kamuzu Stadium before Carthage Eagles thrashed the Flames 7-0 in Tunis.
